abstract: Grace Notes column; Prince George, former welfare hotel on East 28th Street in Manhattan, offering affordable rental residences to previously homeless New Yorkers along with lower-income working single adults, is selling its air rights; move is intended to raise money for improvements and to keep rents low.

keywords.value: Department of Housing Preservation and Development (NYC)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: The Prince George, once an eyesore in the Madison Square Park neighborhood, is selling its air rights to raise money for improvements and to keep rents low.
snippet: The Prince George, once an eyesore in the Madison Square Park neighborhood, is selling its air rights to raise money for improvements and to keep rents low....

headline.main: Deal Aims to Keep a Former Welfare Hotel in Manhattan Affordable
headline.print_headline: A New Chapter for the Building Once Called ‘Hell’s Embassy in Manhattan’
